Christian Krumm wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I got the extraction of linktext, linktitle and linkenvironment of an
> HTML-Anchor implemented useing a custom JerichoExtractorHTML and a
> custom LinkContext. I had to update the version of Jericho manually by
> patching the pom.xml because there has been a lot of OOME using the 2.3
> version, heritrix currently uses. When using the 2.6 version of Jericho
> the OOMEs disapered. If I've finished my diploma thesis I may provide
> the code as contrib to heritrix2, if someone is interessted. Please let
> me know if this is the case and what whould be best practice to
> contribute it to the heritrix2 codebase.

Thanks for the offer!

The best approach to make a contribution is to...
(1) create an issue in the Heritrix JIRA tracker
(2) attach a patch with your changes, or full files of any new classes.
(3) include a statement that you approve its integration to the project, 
under its current and any future open source license. (We are 
transitioning from LGPL-2.1 in current releases to Apache License 2 in a 
to-be-determined future release.)

In our crawls at IA, we currently use ExtractorHTML rather than the 
JerichoExtractorHTML, so we rely on others who use the Jericho version 
to suggest fixes and improvements.

Any feature that's well-tested, of interest to other users, and without 
a complexity/performance cost on those who choose not to use it is a 
good candidate for inclusion in the core distribution. Discussion is 
welcome here or in a tracking JIRA issue about candidate contributions.

Even if a contribution is of more narrow interest, we'd welcome it 
living in our issue tracker or project wiki so it can be discovered and 
integrated by other users who customize the crawler. We might also add a 
'contrib' directory to a future release, if we had a variety of 
contributions that we didn't want to mix with the default core but still 
wanted to make available.

Regarding the Jericho 2.3 versus 2.6 memory issues: there is a previous 
issue requesting an upgrade to the 2.4 version:

http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER-1146

Based on your report of improvements with 2.6, I will be upgrading the 
heritrix (1.x) and heritrix2 trunks to use that version, unless I hear 
objections from others using the JerichoHTMLExtractor.

- Gordon @ IA
